verses.roman:
tatropaspṛśya viśadaṁ
pītvā vāri mahā-rathau
kṛṣṇau dadṛśatuḥ kanyāṁ
carantīṁ cāru-darśanām

synonyms: tatra—there; upaspṛśya—taking bath; viśadam—clear; pītvā—drinking; vāri—the water; mahā-rathau—great chariot warriors; kṛṣṇau—the two Kṛṣṇas; dadṛśatuḥ—saw; kanyām—a maiden; carantīm—walking; cāru-darśanām—charming to see.
translation: After the two Kṛṣṇas bathed there, they drank the river's clear water. The great warriors then saw an attractive young girl walking nearby.
